channel.title: BBC News - World
channel.copyright: Copyright: (C) British Broadcasting Corporation, see http://news.bbc.co.uk/2/hi/help/rss/4498287.stm for terms and conditions of reuse.

item.title: China floods: Thousands evacuated as rail stations and roads submerged
item.description: Record rainfall has left more than 12 dead and flooded stations and roads in Zhengzhou city.

item.title: Jeff Bezos launches to space aboard New Shepard rocket ship
item.description: The world's richest man and three other passengers return safely just over 10 minutes after launch.

item.title: Covid: France rolls out health pass as cases soar
item.description: From Wednesday people will need proof of vaccination or a negative test to access some public places.

item.title: Strife-torn Haiti gets new prime minister
item.description: Ariel Henry's appointment comes nearly two weeks after President Jovenel MoÃ¯se was assassinated.

item.title: Thomas Barrack: Top Trump aide accused of working as foreign agent
item.description: Thomas Barrack is alleged to have lobbied the US government on behalf of the United Arab Emirates.

item.title: The battle for Indonesia's Gold Island
item.description: There are fears that a mine will threaten Sangihe island's ancient forests and local water supply.

item.title: Climate change: US pushes China to make faster carbon cuts
item.description: US climate envoy John Kerry says help from China is needed to avoid a dangerous rise in heat.

item.title: Pegasus: French President Macron identified as spyware target
item.description: The president's phone number was found on a list of numbers that were potential phone hacking targets.

item.title: Israel PM warns Ben & Jerry's owner Unilever of consequences over sales ban
item.description: The ice cream maker's parent company Unilever is told "strong action" will be taken against boycotts.

item.title: Netflix to include mobile games for subscribers
item.description: The firm said on Tuesday that the "time is right to learn more about how our members value games".

item.title: Nike trainer output at key factory hit by Covid outbreak
item.description: Nike could run out of its Vietnamese-made trainers because of a rise in Covid infections in the region.

item.title: Kim Hong-bin: South Korean climber missing after fall in Pakistan
item.description: Kim Hong-bin, who has no fingers, is thought to have fallen into a crevasse on a descent in Pakistan.

item.title: Darfur conflict's latest surge in violence displaces thousands
item.description: "I have cried so much, my eyes can barely see," one mother tells the BBC after seeing her brother die.

item.title: Covid: The Mexican villages refusing to vaccinate
item.description: Take-up of the vaccine among indigenous towns in Chiapas state is as low as 2% in some areas.

item.title: Wally Funk: The 82-year-old on Jeff Bezos's Blue Origin flight
item.description: Wally Funk was overlooked for space flight in the 60s but got a second chance with Jeff Bezos.

item.title: Mandira Bedi: Actress stirs debate over women's role at cremations
item.description: India's Mandira Bedi made news for performing her husband's last rites, generally a male preserve.

item.title: Germany grapples with flood havoc
item.description: A massive clean-up is under way, but Germany's flood damage won't be fixed for many months.

item.title: A weekend in America: Shootings in Washington spotlight growing problem
item.description: A stadium was sent into panic and a six-year-old was killed in two of the weekend's worst shootings.

item.title: Jeff Bezos and crew launch into space on New Shepard
item.description: Billionaire Jeff Bezos has launched into space, in the first crewed flight of his rocket ship, New Shepard.

item.title: Eid al-Adha prayers continue as rockets fired in Afghanistan
item.description: Some of the worshippers in Kabul appeared frightened and unsure what to do when they heard multiple explosions.

item.title: First space tourist Dennis Tito: 'I was euphoric'
item.description: Dennis Tito paid $20 million to travel to the International Space Station in 2001.

item.title: Tokyo Olympics: Athletes find new ways to train in lockdown
item.description: Participants in the upcoming Games have been going to unusual lengths to stay in shape under restrictions.

item.title: Channel crossings migrants: 'We need a safe place'
item.description: A BBC team encounters some of the migrants trying to make the dangerous journey to England.
